taskExplanation:
Here are the changes made between the Before and After code:

1. Added variable declaration:
```al
var
    ReservationEntry: Record "Reservation Entry";
```

2. Added initialization of ReservationEntry fields before the CreateReservEntryFor call:
```al
ReservationEntry."Lot No." := NewLotNo;
ReservationEntry."Serial No." := NewSerialNo;
```

3. Modified the CreateReservEntryFor method call:
- Removed direct parameters `NewSerialNo` and `NewLotNo`
- Added `ReservationEntry` as the last parameter instead

The changes reflect a refactoring to use a Reservation Entry record instead of passing lot and serial numbers directly to the CreateReservEntryFor method. This approach provides better encapsulation and follows Business Central's pattern for handling reservation entries.
inputExample:
local procedure CreateSalesLineReserve(LinVenta: Record "Sales Line"; NewLotNo: Code[20]; NewSerialNo: Code[20]): Boolean
    var
        CrearReserva: Codeunit "Create Reserv. Entry";
    begin
        CrearReserva.CreateReservEntryFor(
            Database::"Sales Line",
            LinVenta."Document Type",
            LinVenta."Document No.",
            '',
            0,
            LinVenta."Line No.",
            LinVenta."Qty. per Unit of Measure",
            LinVenta.Quantity,
            LinVenta."Quantity (Base)",
            NewSerialNo,
            NewLotNo);
    end;
